1.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing

to scratch, i.e. (by implication) to engrave, plough; hence (from the use of tools) to fabricate (of any material); figuratively, to devise (in a bad sense); hence (from the idea of secrecy) to be silent, to let alone; hence (by implication) to be deaf (as an accompaniment of dumbness)
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
strength; as adjective, mighty; especially the Almighty (but used also of any deity)

2.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to make a loud sound (like English 'hum'); by implication, to be in great commotion or tumult, to rage, war, moan, clamor
to lift, in a great variety of applications, literal and figurative, absolute and relative
the head (as most easily shaken), whether literal or figurative (in many applications, of place, time, rank, itc.)

3.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a people (as a congregated unit); specifically, a tribe (as those of Israel); hence (collectively) troops or attendants; figuratively, a flock
properly, to be (or make) bare; but used only in the derivative sense (through the idea perhaps of smoothness) to be cunning (usually in a bad sense)
a session, i.e. company of persons (in close deliberation); by implication, intimacy, consultation, a secret
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk

4.brief: to walk (literally or figuratively); causatively, to carry (in various senses)
to secrete, by act or word; hence (intensively) to destroy
a foreign nation; hence, a Gentile; also (figuratively) a troop of animals, or a flight of locusts
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, to mark (so as to be recognized), i.e. to remember; by implication, to mention;  to be male
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to advise; reflexively, to deliberate or resolve
the heart; also used (figuratively) very widely for the feelings, the will and even the intellect; likewise for the centre of anything
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
a compact (because made by passing between pieces of flesh)
to cut (off, down or asunder); by implication, to destroy or consume; specifically, to covenant (i.e. make an alliance or bargain, originally by cutting flesh and passing between the pieces)

6.brief: a tent (as clearly conspicuous from a distance)
Edom, the elder twin-brother of Jacob; hence the region (Idumaea) occupied by him
a Jishmaelite or descendant of Jishmael
Moab, an incestuous son of Lot; also his territory and descendants
a Hagrite or member of a certain Arabian clan

7.brief: Ammon, a son of Lot; also his posterity and their country
Amalek, a descendant of Esau; also his posterity and their country
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
properly, to sit down (specifically as judge. in ambush, in quiet); by implication, to dwell, to remain; causatively, to settle, to marry

8.brief: properly, assemblage; used only adverbially also, even, yea, though; often repeated as correl. both...and
Ashshur, the second son of Shem; also his descendants and the country occupied by them (i.e. Assyria), its region and its empire
properly, to twine, i.e. (by implication) to unite, to remain; also to borrow (as a form of obligation) or (caus.) to lend
adverb or preposition, with (i.e. in conjunction with), in varied applications; specifically, equally with; often with prepositional prefix (and then usually unrepresented in English)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
the arm (as stretched out), or (of animals) the foreleg; figuratively, force
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)

9.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
Midjan, a son of Abraham; also his country and (collectively) his descendants
Sisera, the name of a Canaanitish king and of one of the Nethinim
Jabin, the name of two Canaanitish kings
a stream, especially a winter torrent; (by implication) a (narrow) valley (in which a brook runs); also a shaft (of a mine)

10.brief: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)

11.brief: to place (in a very wide application)
properly, voluntary, i.e. generous; hence, magnanimous; as noun, a grandee (sometimes a tyrant)
Oreb, the name of a Midianite and of the cliff near the Jordan
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, something poured out, i.e. a libation; also a molten image; by implication, a prince (as anointed)

12.brief: who, which, what, that; also (as an adverb and a conjunction) when, where, how, because, in order that, etc.
to occupy (by driving out previous tenants, and possessing in their place); by implication, to seize, to rob, to inherit; also to expel, to impoverish, to ruin
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative

13.brief: gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
to place (in a very wide application)
a wheel; by analogy, a whirlwind; also dust (as whirled)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)

14.brief: to kindle, i.e. consume (by fire or by eating);  to be(-come) brutish
a copse of bushes; hence, a forest; hence, honey in the comb (as hived in trees)
{a flash; figuratively, a sharply polished blade or point of aweapon}
properly, to lick, i.e. (by implication) to blaze
a mountain or range of hills (sometimes used figuratively)

15.brief: properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to run after (usually with hostile intent; figuratively (of time) gone by)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously

16.brief: to fill or (intransitively) be full of, in a wide application (literally and figuratively)
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to search out (by any method, specifically in worship or prayer); by implication, to strive after
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

17.brief: properly, to pale, i.e. by implication to be ashamed; also (by implication) to be disappointed or delayed
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously
properly, a (peremptory) terminus, i.e. (by implication) duration, in the sense of advance or perpetuity (substantially as a noun, either with or without a preposition)
as far (or long, or much) as, whether of space (even unto) or time (during, while, until) or degree (equally with)
to blush; figuratively, to be ashamed, disappointed; causatively, to shame, reproach
properly, to wander away, i.e. lose oneself; by implication to perish (causative, destroy)

18.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)

19.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
thou and thee, or (plural) ye and you
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, separation; by implication, a part of the body, branch of atree, bar forcarrying; figuratively, chief of a city; especially (with prepositional prefix) as an adverb, apart, only, besides
an elevation, i.e. (adj.) lofty (compar.); as title, the Supreme
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
the earth (at large, or partitively a land)
